docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 -- The recent appointment by President Eisenhower of two career women of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to additional activities in behalf of the children of this hemisphere has focused public attention on the American International Institute for the Protection of Childhood at Montevideo, Uruguay.

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar was active and higher last week as a steady demand brought the currency to its highest premium since early May. A strong undertone marked limited activity in the British pound sterling.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 27 -- The votes of Asian, African, British Commonwealth, Scandinavian and Soviet-bloc countries rolled up a simple majority today in the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 27 -- The votes of Asian, African, British Commonwealth, Scandinavian and Soviet-bloc countries rolled up a simple majority today in the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly for the participation of India in the proposed Far Eastern political conference.
docs.abstract: India fails to win 2/3 majority needed for seating at pol conf; 17 Latin-Amer nations, Greece, Pakistan and Nationalist China back US; 27 vote for inv to India, 11 abstain; roll-call; speculation on whether India will withdraw; Pearson conf with Menon, Lodge, Jebb, others; Lodge scores Vishinsky warning that Communist China and NK may boycott pol conf; backed by Jebb; Vishinsky denies saying exactly that; Assembly com approves 15-nation resolution inviting belligerents on UN side and SK to pol conf; rejects USSR resolution; approves, 55-2, with 2 abstaining, resolution inviting USSR to pol conf 'if other side desires it'; defeats USSR move to delete 'if other side desires it'; approves India resolution on keeping Communist China and NK informed on Assembly proceedings

headline.main: INDIA FAILS TO WIN NEEDED MAJORITY FOR SEAT AT PARLEY; U. N. Committee Tally Is 27-21, Giving Her Less Than the Two-Thirds Required FINAL VOTE IS DUE TODAY Soviet Proposals Are Beaten as Lodge Protests Vishinsky Hint on Balking Talks INDIA FAILS TO WIN NEEDED U. N. VOTE

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Aug. 28 -- Success in the treatment of both acute and chronic forms of gout with the recently developed new drug phenylbutazone was reported today at the eighth International Congress of Rheumatic Diseases. The report was made by a group of...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Aug. 28 -- Success in the treatment of both acute and chronic forms of gout with the recently developed new drug phenylbutazone was reported today at the eighth International Congress of Rheumatic Diseases. The report was made by a group of rheumatologists from the Stanford University School of Medicine in San Francisco headed by Dr. William C. Kuzell.

headline.main: NEW REMEDY FOUND FOR TREATING GOUT; Phenylbutazone Held Effective in 84 Per Cent of 200 Cases, Geneva Parley Is Told PATIENTS' RESPONSE CITED Study Shows It More Lasting Than Cortisone or ACTH in Its Beneficial Effects

byline.original: By WILLIAM L. LAURENCESpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: I have read your editorial "Return From a Mission," commenting on Dr. Milton Eisenhower's trip through South America. The editorial considers the trip a success and comes to an end with this idea: "Probably the longest test of this success will come...
docs.lead_paragraph: I have read your editorial "Return From a Mission," commenting on Dr. Milton Eisenhower's trip through South America. The editorial considers the trip a success and comes to an end with this idea: "Probably the longest test of this success will come next March, when the Tenth Conference of American States convenes at Caracas.
